rename.from: Commit author association regression in v1.24+
rename.to: Commit list author rendering regression in v1.24+

body: To fix this, we should make commit list author rendering the same as for the latest commit. There is no reason these have different implementations.

Related to:

* #34882 
* #33595
* #33528
* #34641
* #34423 
* #34643


And please provide reproducible steps, and cc @lunny
Issue 2 should reproduce for commits with any e-mail address that does not exist in gitea. Issue 1 is harder to reproduce, but I do see it in my local instance, so I can investigate there.
If a commit doesn't match existing Gitea user, then the commit's "git user" value will be filled into the link. It is not a regression, but an old behavior.
But is it expected that this generates 404 links? In 1.23 and in last commit info, no link is generated for non-existant users.
I think we should add a `templates/repo/commit_author.tmpl` to render the author (with or without link) and their avatar and use it everywhere.

> But is it expected that this generates 404 links? In 1.23 and in last commit info, no link is generated for non-existant users.

Hmm, so it is a regression from 

*   #33528

issue.title: Improve commits list performance to reduce unnecessary database queries

labels.name: lgtm/done
labels.description: This PR has enough approvals to get merged. There are no important open reservations anymore.

labels.name: modifies/go
labels.description: Pull requests that update Go code

repository.name: gitea
repository.description: Git with a cup of tea! Painless self-hosted all-in-one software development service, including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD

issue.body: When listing commits, Gitea attempts to retrieve the actual user based on the commit email. Querying users one by one from the database is inefficient. This PR optimizes the process by batch querying users by email, reducing the number of database queries.

body:
You can see an example of the invalid links generated here:

https://gitea.com/gitea/act/commits/branch/main

Commits with the gitea icon are external users, they should not render a link.
Bug also affects commits in the pull request timeline (wrong avatar rendered, and the link over the avatar is the same broken 404 link).

issue.body:
A quick fix for #34991 

`ValidateCommitsWithEmails` will create a fake user for a git commit user with a related Gitea user. The UI should not display a link for such users.
